Posts.Content: Hi, I take letrozole and I've been on it 3 yrs now but I also take a calcium, vit d, tumeric, fermented fish oil, cumin supplements and I've been fine Sally
Posts.Title: Letrozol and vitamins

Posts.Content: Well done u, I did it after my treatment, a yr after and I had I'm doing it for me as a survivor and I heard a lady as I passed her say to her friend  oh good for her, how wonderful xxx,
Posts.Title: Race - well Walk for life:)

Posts.Content: Hi Elvis1,  I was diagnosed with just stage 2 4-5 weeks ago, but they have said they have taken enough on the wide local excision, so not offered masectomy thankfully..... but I do have to have node clearance this week, so I am wondering why as a stage 2 you are having masectomy, unless your lump is quite large???? When I got my results last tuesday about one node out of the 2 they took being shown as cancer in it, I was very very low, and wednesday was one of my lowest days so far. But being on here, has helped and lifted me since then.  But you do need to say what stage/grade and results of other tests on here for other people to give you some sound advice of what they have been through, as its all different for each person.  xxxx
Posts.Title: FEELING SO DOWN

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy dont want to be mean but lucky you, im still trying to lose the chemo/steroid wait and i finished treatement in october, then on letrozole for 5 years, tell me your secret, cos its really getting me down, i am supposed to be fixed, and to be honest, i had less pain etc on chemo... how sad is that!!!!, i really do need to lose the weight and get back to "normal" cheers Sally
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi All,,   its one year today that I got my dreaded news after tests 3 days before, I never thought I would get to this date, never thought I could see light at the end of the tunnel, but apart from needing to shift 2 stone, [any ideas please], I now have been finished treatment for nearly 5 months, apart from the tablet for 5 years, and started playing hockey again, had my first trim yesterday to tidy things up even though hair is still shorter than my normal short hair, but it looks normal, didn't sleep too well last night, obviously, but this anniversary will be over in a few hours, and that's one out the way, got apt next month for a year after WLE and ANC ops, so that's another one to get out the way.  Love to all, lets hope I NEVER have to go through these days again, not sure I would be up to it...  xxx Sally
Posts.Title: One year on........

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy dont want to be mean but lucky you, im still trying to lose the chemo/steroid wait and i finished treatement in october, then on letrozole for 5 years, tell me your secret, cos its really getting me down, i am supposed to be fixed, and to be honest, i had less pain etc on chemo... how sad is that!!!!, i really do need to lose the weight and get back to "normal" cheers Sally
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi,, unfortunately it wont matter what you do,, whilst you are on the hormone reducing AI's weight gain is part and parcel. I am active, and do almost as much as you, but cant shift an ounce.. did slimming world, not a ounce came off, really depressing its unfortunately not going to help except keep you fit Ive put on 2 and a half stone and i hate myself, hate my body, and im really depressed about it but whilst im on these darn things im going to have to do all i can but just accept it cheers Sal
Posts.Title: how to lose weight on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Luckily I went in after my ops and discussed going foward workwise with management and what I wanted to do, Idid not want to be signed for 6 months sick, because I felt Im not actually "ill", I was just having treatment, and I would only sign off sick if I wasnt functioning and that I would need work to have something to focus on. so I work from home, because the hospital did not want me in the office, as its an air conditiioned building and anyone coming in and out could bring any manner of things in on them.. so    so far so good for me, 2nd chemo is next week, and its being reduced
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and work

Posts.Content: Hi. Please do not use any perm solution on yr hair. My hair came thru curly but now back to normal  It does take a while of just using a round brush wen u blow dry it to straighten it. This is what my hairdresser told me. He said never use chemicals just get some argan oil to condition it. 3 yrs on and I love the argan oil. Sally xx
Posts.Title: Curly Hair!

Posts.Content: Hi, I was diagnosed with Breast Cancer 4-5 weeks ago, had op to remove lump, and they also removed the Sentinel node and one other node. I had my results on Tuesday and am very very disappointed. The margin around the lump is clear, and one node is clear - good news, however, the other node showed cancer, so I am now having to go back into hospital next week to have all the nodes removed.  Apparently this is the next "step" , and to be honest Im not the sort of person who lives for the short answer.  Everyone told me to be positive pre results day, and I thought I was, and I was let down, what if I get let down again on the next set of results for the nodes removal. I have always been a strong independent person, but I am so low, I have not felt this low since my dad died. I play hockey, I have an allotment, I do not sit down and Im not a good patient, and I feel my life is out of control, and Im not good with it. Now I know that there are other ladies out there who are probably far worse off than me, but my family have never had inkilings of breast cancer, I thout I was doing everything well to avoid stroke and brain haemorrage in our family, and I get this,,,,, I never saw this one coming. Im angry, low, and I dont know what to do. I dont know where to turn, Im emotional and I dont do that. Stiff upper lip and all that,  I want to get back to normal and go back to work. Has anyone out there been through the same as me. I have a stage 2 lump removed and it was 2cm if that helps. estrogen clear. How do I cope with no nodes, and if its in the one how do I know its not gone into the rest of the body. thanks xxx
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: Hi, They say they need to take all nodes out, as one was clear and one was showing signs of cancer, and that I may benefit from chemo and that they also may give me a tablet thats a blocker, but that they wont know for sure until my next results from op are done, and I go back on 29th. I am eastrogen free, which is good as my ovaries dont work now anyway, I am also good on the HER test. I cannot have HRT as I suffer from migraines so when ovaries died off 2 years ago I dont have any tablets to take.
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: Hi Caroline, thank you for your reply and support, and thank you for explaining to me that I have really good news, re one test, as I dont understand alot of it, and I am sorry that you dont have that result, but I am thinking of you and hope all goes well for you soon. You have lifted me in the fact that you have said I have good news in part, so take hope and support from that xxx god bless
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: Hi George and Jackie - thank you for taking the time replying. Mine was a stage 2 11mm lump that they took out, and you are right there is alot going on in my head at the moment.. Consultant didnt say anything about PR - all he mentioned was Oestragen which I was fine for, and HER was fine, so that was all good.  I had a hysterectomy in 1999 and my ovaries died 2 years ago and Im not on HRT as they wont give it due to migraines, and I dont suffer any symptoms of any kind.  I hate taking tablets anyways, and 5 years ago was diagnosed with under active thyroid, and the tablets made me feel crap, and I ran out so didnt get to chemist for repeat prescription for about a month, where I felt great, so I didnt bother taking any more, and since then they just send me for monitoring every 3 months for a blood test and my TSH levels have been up and down, and last bloods for that they were ok so dont have to go for another for 3 months but then had to go with this damn lump that I found quite by accident and the rest now as they say is history.  So all good apart from the one node showing cancer cells leaving me with another op next week for anxcillary node removal. To be honest I dont really understand, Ive just got his thing in my mind that says if its in one node then its already in my system, and Im scared.
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: Hi Cbaz..... I really hope your results are clear first time, because I did everything friends and family told me to do and be positive, and that everything would be fine, they were sure, but it wasnt, although not devasting news 2nd time in, not the news I had hoped for and I was really really disappointed, and the 2 days after Tuesday of this week, were very very low days.  Yesterday was better, and I have had a good nights sleep last night, so woke up feeling better because I have not been thinking of it all night. So I am going to keep my fingers and toes crossed for you, but I after my experience this week, wont say its going to be fine, in case I put the kybosh on it for you...xxx  I do feel for you, I really do because its the damn waiting that is the worst..., may god bless you, because I really dont want anyone to go through this...xxx
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: SEriously ladies, we have been through hell already, and anything that worries you should be examined properly by scans and stuff, so its your right to be sent for a proper investigation, feeling in my opinion is not enough, you have paid taxes and health payments in your salary to have this treatment so its your right to have it... put your foot down, these is not just a rash or anything that can be sorted with creams,, especially when they know your history, they need to send you off for scans and get the right diagnosis and treatment, and your peace of mind... Stress is not a good thing to have once you have been what we have been through... hope all goes well and be firm xxxxx Sally
Posts.Title: Confused??????

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies you have helped.  Will i be able to play hockey again, and do my allotment and how long will it be before I can start doing those things again, i know everyone is different but Im not planning on being out of action for too long so any guidelines you can give is appreciated.. and Im going back to work as soon as too.
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: Hi Misteymoley....thanks for your reply, my thyroid is being monitored ok, they do do the T3 and T4, and I dont really take alot of notice, because I am well, and I was only borderline when I was diagnosed, and my new doctor said I probably should not have been put on the thyroxine at that time, but I am motivated, lost 2 stone, loved getting up in the mornings, and all was fine off the tablets...which apparently is not normal, because I should have been the other way round, and some would say that Ive never been normal lol.....all I do is go for the test, go to the docs when they call me in to discuss the results, and I tell them Im not going back on the tablets,, and they have sent my results off to a ecrinologist too, and he says my lack of symptoms for one of the levels is weird. So the last blood test I got a letter and I thought here we go again...go and discuss your results, but no, blood test form inside and the letter to tell me that I dont need to go and discuss, that things seem to have settled this time, and have another test in 3 months time.  So Im ok with that.  My brain has now a more serious road to manouvre, and thats the one Im struggling with, although yest and today are slightly better in myself so far, I only actually cried twice yesterday instead of all day, for 2 days x
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: After having all this done, again after anaesthetic 3 weeks after the 1st batch I am now struggling with being constipated, and its bloody awful, any ideas anyone. Eating nuts, taking senakot but its still a struggle, once Ive got this lot out so to speak, Im sure Ill be fine, but god its getting on my nerves...lol
Posts.Title: New Cancer patient

Posts.Content: Hi Little Susie, I had a grade 2 stage 2 pea sized lump, and ANC in left side, but no masectomy, I had a WLE, ANC and chemo and rads, so Im wondering why you had a mastectomy, was it a personal decision... I wasnt offered that so Im thought that was a good thing.  Im all finished now, and just on ck ups and the 5 year tablet...Sally
Posts.Title: Bloody cancer!

Posts.Content: Hi all, on a different post to this i was told to fill in a yellow form, which lets the manufacturers know how bad things are and then if they get enough forms which we should all do to push the issues, they have to do something about it.  link is here https://yellowcard.mhra.gov.uk/yellowcards/reportmediator/ sally
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi all, I have actually emailed Macmillan to find out why after all this time and so many posts of the different brands and the debilitating effects they all have on different people, why oh why someone in the medical profession has not taken this up so that we dont have to suffer all the time, and why they dont understand the difference in 99% of professionals, so we will see what they come back with. Surely this would be an ideal subject for a medical student, to bring it out in the media etc and maybe kick some ass, to highlight the crap we have to go through after treatment, Sally xxx
Posts.Title: supply of letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi zen, keep posting it I suppose or get macmillan to advertise it, Sally xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: hi all, i am 3 yrs past diagnosis and treatment, and this is driving me crazy the last few weeks, having to hang my hand over the arm of a chair to get the life back into it. SAll
Posts.Title: Peripheral neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi, having been on letrozole now for over 2 and a half years, and the hospital has been supplying me with the Accord brand, which suits me, i have had a call from my oncology nurse today to say that the hospital now cannot get it, im so upset, ive been for a walk with the dogs up the local woods and sobbed my heart out. my own gp whom i first went to for repeat in nov 2014, sent the prescription over the road to the pharmacy, of which they supplied me with the Cipla brand, and unbeknown to me at the time, was not aware of any differing side affects from different brands, until i started taking the cipla brand, and within 3 days was a 90 year old cripple, got hold of the chemist and after they reordered to try and get the Accord brand could only supply cipla or actavis, so tried the actavis, not much better, so spoke to oncologist at next appt a month later, after suffering and letting them know whilst on them, so she was aware how bad things were, said they would get hosp pharmacy to supply my original brand that she first put me on, or try arimidex, but have been ok on Accord all this time, yes i do get joint and heel pain, but im fairly stable, back playing hockey for the last 2 years and back on my allotments, walking miles with the dogs, so i thought everything was plodding along nicely as far as it can, and bang wham, get this call today, leaving me, in a right old state. i cant go back to that, i dont know what to do. im so fed up. i have called nurse back and left a msg as to why they cant get it, and what brand can they get, so waiting for a reply, and ive emailed boots to see if they can get it for me, But my world has dropped and i know its just a tablet and its not a recurrence or anything like that, but after everything, you get the rug pulled again from under your feet over just a tablet... :( x i actually dont know where to go from here, i really dont.
Posts.Title: supply of letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi, thanks for all your comments, and i got an appt yesterday with gp, and apparently after going thru the normal process of i cannot ring up on the day for an appt due to work, which is why i book them in advance, receptionist then tells me there is a slot at 1050 yesterday, so i said i would have it thanks, and then she also tells me because im a "purple patient", i can insist on seeing my gp at any time,, who knew!!!!!, so after going in with some snippets off here, and ready for a fight,, gp tells me he can give me the brand that i need, no problem, and that he fully understands the awful side effects of differing brands,, omg, i told him he is the first medical professional i have come across, thru all of this that understands the issues and i thanked him for that, and he said no problem, but getting the chemist to supply the right one might be more difficult, and after going over to the chemist across the road from gp, they have Teva in at the moment so i said no thanks, and asked why its such an issue being able to order the right one as its no cost to them, no cost to supplier it all gets costed to your gp and his budget, and he fully understood that but he said it does come down to cost, but he will speak to all his suppliers and see if they have any Accord brand, and order them in for me, but he can only try. They just get sent what the supplier has at the time when they put their order in. So then off to the hospital pharmacy who have supplied it the last 2.5 yrs, to see what their problem is now, and oncology nurse could have done this but hey pass the buck and i will be mentioning it at my next appt even though its not til jan.  So spoke to lab technician who its their job to get the meds in that are rquired, and she was lovely, and she said she had just had a quick look on system to see what the issue was and apparently there is a problem with Letrozole as a whole across the branded board, but she would need a few days to delve deeper with manufacturer etc, to make sure they order in the brand i have and it will be ordered in solely for my prescriptions only, and that that was her job to do this, because im not the only one on any meds that need a certain brand. She was totally understanding when i said i cannot go back there on cipla or actavis or teva, so all being well it will work out, but i havent got the tablet yet so we will see. So next steps are to pop back next week to chemist to see how he got on, and hosp pharmacy will ring me with conclusions. So quite a productive day, but not complete, so rationing my tablet now to every other day so it gives me a few days longer before running out. :)  xxx Sally
Posts.Title: supply of letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi CC I would never go back on that brand so yes u should try other brands, speak to yr gp or oncologist xx
Posts.Title: supply of letrozole

Posts.Content: hi all, i am 3 yrs past diagnosis and treatment, and this is driving me crazy the last few weeks, having to hang my hand over the arm of a chair to get the life back into it. SAll
Posts.Title: Peripheral neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi, no idea what being out of patent means really, but alliance do still supply the Accord brand of letrozole, so i have emailed them for information and i have sent a lengthy email to onc nurse, however she says i need to discuss with the hosp pharmacy, and my point was why should i have to do all the running around, and i can see fm other posts the same in some cases, so why isnt someone doing something about this globally, to stop patients having to go thru more stress, by chasing their own brand that has been described for a bloody reason, its not our job, im so bloody angry, upset, causing me more stress when life was being bearable. why are we having to have this conversation on here with everyone, why isnt macmillan picking this up and taking it forward, they are supposed to be here for us apparently. so whats next..... i stop taking it because other brands cause so much heartache, and then get a recurrence, having to then have more costly surgery, chemo and rads, when all it takes is for someone to sort it all out and give us the tablet thats ok, at ,much more minimal cost than surgery, chemo and rads, less stress all round.  Sally xxx
Posts.Title: supply of letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi, I am going through the same sort of thing, have my first chemo on 27th May, and not looking forward to it one bit, wasnt in my plan in life....however, I have been up and down since diagnosis, and ops, and you just have to let it out, all the stress of worrying and trying not to cry, just adds to the worry and stress, take one day at a time,, keep busy, that has helped me, and family and friends are a great help in little ways, even though they dont know what you are going through. Do not worry about other aches and pains, Ive had to slap myself and have a word with myself, just think about the fact you may have had those before your diagnosis,but didnt really take much notice, but now they are exaggerated by the fact you are going through this.  take care xxxxx remember one day at a time as I keep being told..xx Sally
Posts.Title: What ifs........

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Not sure if you want any information on this but it might be helpful, I think im going to give it a go just for my heels Its called Paingone, and its some kind of electrical therapy pen for pain relief Apparently its pretty good, so Ill try anything once cheers Sally
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi, Im sorry about your husband, and I dont know why Im apologising for him, he is a twat, sorry but that is the truth. Your husband will NEVER NEVER know how it feels to have cancer unless he gets it. No one knows about the emotional and mental turmoil you go thru, and will always go thru even though its technically gone physically. Mentally it will never go away but you do have to get on with your life otherwise all that pain and suffering will be for nothing for you. I have no further words for him, except he is a selfish :::::::::::::. God forbid he gets it, because I wouldnt wish it on anyone but if he does if he was my husband I wouldnt be going to his appts with him. all my love Sally 22 months clear I am, but still have niggles off and on, and will do for life, even the emotional stuff xxxx
Posts.Title: Husband remark to cancer

Posts.Content: Hi,  Jane Not sure if this is going to help, but Im 2 years past all treatment and still get pins and needles in my fingers mainly Sal
Posts.Title: Pins and needles

Posts.Content: Hi Blue_Roan,,, does this Glutamin help after you have had treatment, and are suffering from the pins and needles and numbness? cheers SAlly
Posts.Title: Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hi im just over 3 yrs past treatment, and im abit concerned that you only saw the oncologist for 3 yrs and then signed off,, if you are on an AI for 5 yrs or more you should be getting annual appts, i am for both oncology and surgery, and i have a bone scan every 2 years, i had one before treatment, one in 2016 as was due one after 2 yrs, and ill get one this year as its 2 yrs since i had the last one,, so why you  were signed off is beyond me, but yes you are entitled to any scan whatever they say...all the best sally x
Posts.Title: Is a Bone Scan after 5 years on Anastrozole a given?

Posts.Content: Hi, i had 3 FEC and was just tired, but then had 3 Tax, oh my days,   day 3-6 vile,,, thout i was going to die, had to have tablets to counteract the awful indigestion and heartburn which ive never suffered with before ever.... pain in places i didnt think would be there.... sorry to be the bearer of this news but everyone is different so, take it with a pinch of salt, unfortunately you only know when day 3 or 4 hits and you wake up and get thru the day, and then u will know how you are going to be on the next sessions of tax and when the awful days are,,,give it a good kicking,, Sally
Posts.Title: Taxotere side effects info please

Posts.Content: Hi, I had mine 3 yrs ago, and due to them having to cut thru nerves the numbness will always be there, as nerves will take yrs to heal if ever they do, and it's always weird feeling. But I was fine, just a bit sore, the drain for 5 days was a bit of a pain though, just got in the way. Lyphoedema is manageable as long as you are careful.  All the best sally xx
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Hi Bunmi I dont know without looking what Megastrol is, but I would say that you could have after chemo the Neuropathy whereby you will have nerve damage from the chemo, I still have this in fingers 18 months on from chemo, some days are better than others, some days they just go pins and needles and numbish which is annoying, and it could take years for it to subside if ever.  I just take normal painkillers to ease the annoyance of it.. cheers Sally
Posts.Title: Megastrol

Posts.Content: Hi, you are a very brave lady, xx
Posts.Title: Declining further treatment after breast surgery

Posts.Content: Hi, are you on letrozole, you can get a random cough on that, I did and was referred to ear nose and throat as it was my throat I was coughing from, chest xray all clear and throat etc clear, then I saw a post on here about a month after re coughing on letrozole. It's gone now all on its own, but it will be something else that crops up next time, a month, a week here and there, it's just the side affects. But you do get paranoid so don't worry, and they understand if you keep going back, I try not to, but I have spoken to my oncology nurse first, then if still worried and it's not going I make an appt at gp xxxx sally
Posts.Title: Coughing with no other symptoms

Posts.Content: Hi All, im 8 months past treatment just taking the Letrozole now, and I have got myself a plastic box, and all my medical cards, letters, hats, wig etc all goes in there, and the lid went on. its in a box, shut away.  xxx
Posts.Title: Said my goodbyes

Posts.Content: Hi my 2nd session of chemo is next tuesday and my head is sore today, but i have short hair anyway, dont do long hair, and its only dropping a strand here and there now and again, and im not looking forward to anything else happening, so im hanging onto it as long as possible, but thats me, its the worst fear of this i have had. I have just washed it gently and its now ok...
Posts.Title: Hair loss - sore scalp

Posts.Content: Maggie Anne lol love what u said, hear hear xxxx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Hi, I have started getting this the last 2 weeks and Im 2 years past surgery, REally annoying, went to my 2nd annual check with breast surgeon yesterday and mentioned it whilst i was there and he said that i need to via GP, as the symptoms are all looking at Carpal Tunnel syndrome,, and im thinking bloody hell as if i havent been through enough :(  Sally
Posts.Title: Carpal tunnel syndrome

Posts.Content: Hi, sorry about your friend but yes this is what cancer does to us but that is completely normal, we are bound to worry about small things that we probably had before off and on but just brushed them off. But having gone through the emotional, physical and mental turmoil of finding something, tests, waiting, diagnosis, treatment and then on medication for a number of years having lost control of your life for around a year, and then after still not being in total control but having some normality back, does not  give her right to say things about something she will never understand unless she gets it, I would have said something or even broken down in tears to show her what it actually means. Sorry but you need to change yr friend.  Love and hugs Sally  xx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Hi, I take fermented fish oil capsules,  tumeric, cumin, every day from seventh wave organic website  Stevie Q Hi all, I have been taking Letrozole for the past 17 days (not that I am counting!). I was wondering how long in people's experience did it take for side effects to kick in?  I have only had some stiffness in the joints in my hand.  Long may it last! I was also wondering if anyone is taking calcium, cod liver oil or products with biotin in as a supplement? Many thanks sisters xx
Posts.Title: Letrozole - side effects and supplements

Posts.Content: Hi, ive been on letrozole since oct 2014, and unless someone tells me its a good idea to further stay on them after 5 years, ie what are my personal statistics from results, to benefit 10 or 15 I dont know whether ill stay on them until that decision is made and of course, treatments would have changed again by another 3 years for my review on how long to stay on them after 5, cos even though im ok on them , well better than alot of people, and im doing my normal activities that i was doing before cancer, i dont think i want to stay on them, ie joints,,, risk of bone crumbling cos thats what they do, and being fat, im sick of that...Sal xx
Posts.Title: AI's for up to 15 yrs

Posts.Content: Hi there, Yes I had a WLE, and a sentinel node x2, one was clear and one wasnt, and had the results 10 days after op, and following week had to go in for node clearance, so it is quite normal depending on what their process is.
Posts.Title: Lymph Node Sentinel Test

Posts.Content: Hi my eyes are worse than they were before chemo, just one of those flipping things you have to put up with after treatment, I try and avoid wearing my glasses if I can, but I only tend to wear them whilst driving if my eyes are really tired Sal
Posts.Title: Eyesight after treatment ?

Posts.Content: Hi All, hope your all well and any treatments are not too rough for you, but I have a question. I am now 7 months past end of treatment and am now just on Letrozole, but my question is,,, how do you know if any cancer has returned.? I have just had my first surgeons check up after a year, and all was fine, and my first mammogram after treatement is on 11 May, but they will only be checking the boobs obviously. No blood test or anything was taken and im just wondering how  would you know, I only found out this time by accident, but this question is the only thing that bugs me really now from time to time.xx
Posts.Title: How do you know?....

Posts.Content: Hi, yep its all abit of a this is what you have, been here, do that , go there, take this, and for your surgery you will have weepy days, Im now on chemo, and just had second session, and hair is now coming out and I have had a bit  of a meltdown today as this was probably the worst thing and didnt want, its totally freaked me out today, and I dont see it getting better any time soon, but other side affects have been alot less so I can count my blessings, but I have had just about enough of the whole experience now from being diagnosed beginning of March.  You will need to wake up in the morning every day, and think to yourself  right I feel ok, Idont have pain, can I get up, oh yes thats good, right then, off we go,,, then take every day one at a time like that,,, if you feel like a nap then sleep, its another few hours down the line to the finish, and thats how Im looking at it, but wish I could sleep all the way til its over. God bless you,   keep thinking good things, and come on here and talk, rant, chat, rave about anything,, no one judges you, we have all done it xx SAlly
Posts.Title: I feel Shellshocked.

Posts.Content: Hi , i take it every day in capsule form from Seventh Wave organic website.. ill take anything natural that fights any rogue cells...cheers sally
Posts.Title: Tumeric and aches and pains

Posts.Content: Hi Karen,  you need to speak to yr oncologist if you cannot cope, because I am on the Accord brand of letrozole and that's OK for me, still get joint pain but you will on any of the tablets they give you. But if I go on any other brand I  am a 90 yr old cripple in 3 days of being on them. You need to get a brand that suits you better. But you need to trial and error unfortunately which takes a bit of time, I was going to change and try tamoxifen but I then changed my mind in that it's better the devil you know after reading other posts.  Hope all goes well but don't suffer so you can't function or sleep cheers Sally xx
Posts.Title: Don't think I can cope on Letrozole

Posts.Content: Hi, I had shortness of breath after 4th one, when walking, very annoying and frustrating, just pace yourself and take each day as it comes xx sally
Posts.Title: Short of breath

Posts.Content: Hi all thought u mite b interested in this. I will b discussing with my oncologist sg.news.yahoo.com/two-generic-drugs-reduce-breast-cancer-deaths-studies-041104525.htm
Posts.Title: New treatment

Posts.Content: Hi Kacang yes please i would like to know about this compression garment and the pad thing, cheers Sally
Posts.Title: Breast pain months after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Kacang yes please i would like to know about this compression garment and the pad thing, cheers Sally
Posts.Title: Breast pain months after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi all, hope all is well with you all, and if you are still going through treatment best of wishes and luck, but I have a question, and I know that turmeric is a good cancer busting herb, so when I was at my last reflexology session she asked if I had tried it, and I said I had it in food, but she said that she takes turmeric capsules and they are totally vegetarian and no chemicals, from a place called SEventh Wave, and I am wondering if anyone knows if they will be ok to take with LEtrozole.......cheers love Sally
Posts.Title: Question

Posts.Content: Hi all, come on to have a rant, I have got up and now its 1320 gmt and I am sitting here, so bored, and just burst into tears,, dont know why, have been and had node removal on wed and drain in, thats getting on my nerves today for the first time, again I dont know why, and Ive had to take my surgical sock off left leg, as its got the surgical sock on, a normal sock, it feels cold and numbish, and is driving me nuts,,,, it feels weird...  and that is annoying me too. Im hoping this is just the anaesthetic that is maybe starting to leave my system or what I dont know, but Im feeling quite stupid about it all. This is not like me at all....sorry ladies.....x
Posts.Title: Having a bad day/weird feeling in leg and foot

Posts.Content: Thank you mistymoley,,,hope u are having a good easter x
Posts.Title: Having a bad day/weird feeling in leg and foot

Posts.Content: Hiya, im afraid you may have this for months even years, im now 7 months past my treatment and both arms especially my right one, fingers as well have this. the right one had the chemo in. its a case of putting up with it, im quite often hanging my arm over the arm of the chair at work to get the blood going down to it. its so annoying. playing hockey it goes numb, my only pain is in my finger and i could actually cut that off when it comes on... love Sally x
Posts.Title: Arm pain, numbness, pins & needles, only at night.......?

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies, its now 8.07pm and Im feeling abit better, and you must all be right, as getting it out, obviously is good therapy, Hope you are all well or on the road to getting well and getting free of this buggeration that is driving us nuts.....god bless you.xxxxx
Posts.Title: Having a bad day/weird feeling in leg and foot

Posts.Content: Hi all,, I had breast cancer last march 2014 diagnosed, had WLE and ANC, then 4 months of chemo and 1 month rads, and that all finished in oct 2014, now on letrozole for 5 years. However, since chemo ive had a what I can only describe as a weird pain on the left side of my head, I cant explain it, but it just every so often if I move my head, feels as it something is going to twang or pop, and I stop the head movement, and then slowly move and its gone, but on one occasion felt it and also felt a creaky feeling in cheek/jaw,  and now im actually getting a headache pain more, and im so worried that it is more bad news,   has anyone else had this type of feeling/pain... im not sure whether to go to gp or phone oncology macmillan nurse. im just so scared, surely it cant come back this quick when I was told they had got it all, and the chemo was only a precautionary wash out...!!!! thanks Sally
Posts.Title: Scared and Worried

Posts.Content: Hi I have been taking it now for 6 months and take it at night just before I go to bed, but it does not follow that any funny stuff happens in the night whilst asleep, as ive not been sleeping properly since all this started over a year ago, and I wake sometimes with the joint pain, my right forefinger is the worst at the moment, it has got abit of shitty pain and sometimes I just want to cut it off. so there is no hard and fast rule as to when u take it as long as you do remember to take it,, so personal choice I think, whatever works best for you cheers Sally xx
Posts.Title: Letrezole

Posts.Content: Hi,, i have had this for months, and i did mention it at 2nd year surgeon review in may, and he said it could possibly be carpal tunnel syndrome and to see gp to progress, but i thought it was from chemo in 2014.  its bloody annoying, cos when you are doing something my right hand goes numbish and has pins and needles,,  Sally x
Posts.Title: Peripheral Neuropathy

Posts.Content: Hiya,, I have just had 2nd chemo session yesterday, and I was starting to lose my hair about 4 days ago, and I think this will tip it over the edge as it was worse yesterday and today, its more, so I think by the end of next week I will have lost the lot, but heres hoping I can hang on to every strand hahaha. I thought about the cap, but I suffer from migraines so it was not advisable so binned that idea especially when its not guranteed that it will work, and seeing everyone faces that has had it on yesterday all squashed up, and having to be in the unit for more time before and more time after chemo with it on didnt feel me with much happiness, so I made the decison not to do it, esp if I went through the pain of having in on and then lose the hair anyway, but again its a personal choice.
Posts.Title: Hair worries

Posts.Content: Hi no problem, i actually didnt know that the indentation is one of the factors, and i just thought it was an older age thing as im 54 now but was 51 when it was noticed, and then only actually noticed the lump by accident 3 months later, having had a mammogram 18 months before and all clear, so if i had not noticed the lump by accident, it would have been a further 18 months before i went for my next mammo. So some would say i was lucky, maybe i was in that instance, but obviously not so lucky to be told that it was early stage BC, and a complete shock to say the least because i have always played sport, got allotments, ate healthy stuff albeit the odd cake or so. But all around me could not believe that i got this. So after discussions and research it doesnt matter what age you are, or anything, its not just genetic, it is totally random, there was a lady on here last week aged 24 who was just diagnosed, and when i was initially with BC nurse, she said my hospital alone average 8-10 positive diagnosis a week, which totally shocked me.   Im now 3 yrs on from diagnosis and surgery, next month will be 3 yrs since chemo started, then oct will be 3yrs since radiotherapy, and then on letrozole which is a sod in itself, but im now on a brand of the tablet that is not so bad, i am still playing hockey, still doing my allotments and walking the dogs, everything i did before, but with joint pain from tablets, which only happens after i get up from sitting down so if i didnt sleep or sit down at all, i would be fine lol silver lining and all that, but its pushed to the back of my mind otherwise you drive yourself mad with all the what ifs. I now have given up sugary stuff, any white goods, like rice, bread, pasta, although never a big pasta fan. I take tumeric every day, fermented fish oil, and vitamin D, so i get by but some days i still have a sobbing session, but apparently this is good for you, and you need to get the stress out. Stress being one of the biggest factors in BC. I also do weekly tai chi class which is so relaxing and i have reflexology once a month. Im not one for sitting down for long. lol All the best for you guys, and being on here will help and support you immensley should you, god forbid, get disappointing news. cheers Sally
Posts.Title: Indentation

Posts.Content: Hi sorry to see you hear, but unfortunately this is one of the symptoms that shows BC may be present, I had a small indent looking like orange peel and didnt think anything of it, and then had a lump 3 months later but it could very well be nothing other than cysts, so dont worry until you have to, you will go mad but just be prepared for them to do an examination, biopsy, ultrasound, and mammogram, and you get the results within 10days keep your chin up and i have my fingers crossed for you Sally xx
Posts.Title: Indentation

Posts.Content: Hiya Fabulous news. I'm so happy for you. All the very best  Sally
Posts.Title: Indentation

Posts.Content: Hi Im afraid that you will have to succumb to having the numbness forever, it may get better as nerves do repair but take a hell of a long time..  im 3 years on from surgery almost come April, and although its better in some parts of the underarm, its still not in other parts, and itching is a pain in the proverbial...., but in the grand scheme of things its better than being deceased.....some days I can cope with the numbness and sometimes I get annoyed, but I do massage it, and that should help the healing apparently, but its a long job Im afraid, all the best, Sally xx
Posts.Title: Getting back to exercise. And underarm sensitivity.

Posts.Content: Hi All,,, I have this last month not being able to move my arm as much as I used to without some pain in the shoulder area, and my surgery/chemo and rads were all finished 5 months ago, surgery nearly a year ago and chemo in the middle of those 2. I have been fine but this last month both shoulders have developed pain but the left one is really painful/stiff when moving into certain positions and I certainly cannot get my arms up my back to do my bra up any more.  But I wear sports bras now anyway.  Anyone else had this a year or so on from treatments..  No swelling in arm or wrist but fingers are fatter or swollen, I just thought that was due to weight but people seem to think my hand is swollen not fat.cheers Sally
Posts.Title: Tight arm feeling

Posts.Content: Hi all you lovely people, I had my results today after 2nd op of having my nodes removed, and they removed 13 and 3 of them show cancer, is this good or bad?. I am now looking at chemo of some sort, not sure what yet as oncologist appt not til 12th May. But they reckon 6 months, maybe less dependant on type of chemo, and radiotherapy which I knew on the lump area removed 1 month ago. also a tablet of some inhibitor for 5 years, so any of you got any advice on what I will expect, anyone had the cool cap during chemo to stop you losing your hair, what it feels like, side affects of it. any help would be appreciated. Not the news I wanted, or hoped for, but no more surgery they tell me. I was so positive at this 2nd lot of results and have had the rug pulled from under me yet again. I have no idea why this is happening to me unless I was such a cow to someone in a former life.... I am so deflated. x
Posts.Title: Advice - any much appreciated

Posts.Content: Hi Ive been on letrozole now for a year, and have noticed over the last couple of months at times, I get a feeling like palpitations, or that I can feel my heartbeat thumping, and in my head, so its abit weird, so I will mention at my next oncology apt which is due in January sometime. Im overweight now cos of the chemo and steroids last year, and I really need to lose it,  cheers Sal x
Posts.Title: Letrozole and increased heart rate

Posts.Content: Hi all, thank you for your support as always,,, ive been into see gp today, and had a complete meltdown,,, due to relief that the dreaded thingy is not back,,,, and the gp profusely apologised for the trauma over the weekend, but also said that if there was anything going on, they would have called me, sent a letter and emailed me as soon as scans were analysed,, so to wait the 3 days was about the norm these days due to modern technology, online and all that, and that the consultant that checked my scans was obviously efficient and on top of his game so he had no backlog,, but they havent done any bloods for 2 years so she is sending me for a full blood mot, so thats booked for monday, so my arm will be much lighter on monday lol xxx.. the cream she has given me has relieved the pain, but she says it could be age related menuaporsal symptoms, and in my head scan just the end of the vessels are general wear and tear, no lesions, no stroke indicators, nothing serious,, so all good, so after being the person that this damned disease has turned me into, even when you try hard to push it to the back of your mind, and learn again to live a fairly normal life,, im now so relieved.... sally xxxx
Posts.Title: well i am now very worried

Posts.Content: Hi all, just need a chat,, 4 years post treatment and on letrozole,,  and the last 2 months had some weird symptoms,, a burning pain on the outside of, excuse me,,  "down the nether region", not whilst going to the loo or anything just random, and when it comes its an intense burning, so its not right,,, and also the other end, keep getting the smell of cigarette smoke, again random,, and no one smokes, so with the pain down there, i went off to gp for a chat,, she examined me and said it wasnt sore, and it isnt,, gave me some cream to take but said with whats gone on, send me for a mri x2, just to be cautious,, so no worries,, scan date came thru for last wednesday just gone,, and get told results will be with gp in 2 weeks time,, so off home i go, then today saturday 3 days after mri's, i get a letter to make a routine appt with gp to discuss results they have got from hospital online.... now call me paranoid, scared, or whatever because this is what bc has done to me,,,to all of us,, im now worried sick, that its back, lets face it, who gets their mri or xray results that quick, they must have had to see those results on wed night/thursday for the gp to get a letter out to me to arrive today..  i cant go back there, i cant go thru it all again.. getting results that quick has only to be bad news... sally xx
Posts.Title: well i am now very worried

Posts.Content: Hi All,, I was put onto Letrozole in October 14, and I had the ACCORD brand from the hospital whilst on Rads, and all was fine for 4 weeks, then had to get a repeat, whereby the local chemist gave me the tablet made by CIPLA, omg within 2-3 days i was crippled, with bad joint pain, and when on here asking it seems there are 5 companies who make Letrozole and its the fillers/coatings on the tablet that causes the issues, so if you have been put on it and find a brand that suits you YOU are entitled to have that brand and your GP just needs to put it on the prescription for you. Im now back on the ACCORD brand from hospital as discussed it with oncologist at last appointment, and she said I should not be inpain, we need to get you on the treatment that suits you. So I got another prescription from her, and I can now get this from hospital. BUT in saying that if your GP puts it on your repeat prescriptions then ANY chemist[boots told me this the chemist herself], are obliged to get it for you because its not them that are paying for it as its your GP that is paying for it... hope this helps... Sally x
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a WLE and ANC last year, and the nerves are cut to get to the nodes unfortunately, they cant get round them, my arm is numbish under the arm, but I have full movement, and it feels weird. Sometimes it feels heavy and like its massive but when you look at it it actually isnt, you just have to be careful in not cutting yourself on that arm, and if you do clean it straight away, I havent cut myself and Ive got an allotment, and I use gloves for most tasks anyway and always have a set of antiseptic wipes up there. If you are careful you will be fine.  I had cording afterwards, but my BCN showed me some exercises to do and it was gone within a month, to stretch it out is painful but the reward when its gone is great, and Ive been fine ever since and that was last April,, best of luck Sally x
Posts.Title: Lymph node removal and under arm nerve

Posts.Content: Hi ladies This has settled me a bit, as I had my op in March WLE then node removal middle of Apr, and now 3 months on scars are fine, but still have like a bruise pain just between the drain hole and the node scar, and also last night it felt like someone was pushing a pin/needle in my left breast where the op was done, I thought someone had a voodoo doll of me somewhere, it was very unnerving but this morning nothing. anyone had these pains 3 months on....after op... doing chemo at the moment which is a joy.. not....although i have been lucky so far on - start my tax tomorrow......groan!!!
Posts.Title: Post surgery sensitivity

Posts.Content: Hi Mira Yes it is used alot for lymphodema, i use it, it basically works all the tissue to push the affected build up of fluid to the good side where the nodes are still there, and flushes that fluid into the normal bodily system to flush out the normal way It does look weird depending on how they have put it on, but it does last a few days, and when it starts to peel at the edges you just snip those bits off and leave the stuck stuff on until it all comes off then put a fresh bit on all the best  Sally
Posts.Title: Kinesio Taping - request for information

Posts.Content: Hi, had 3rd mammogram after treatment yesterday and got asked to go on a trial for research into how long u should have mammography for after treatment care, ie they are looking at whether it's better yearly or 2 yearly, to avoid being anxious, plus research into the quality of life and issues after treatment, anyone else on here  been asked
Posts.Title: Mammo 50

Posts.Content: Hi, they are not saying less scans, just gaining information on the frequency, it could be you have more but every 2 years, as it is under the current program it's every 3 years, and they do call u b4 50, I was called at 47 then next one was 50 which was clear, then 18 months later I only accidentally found my lump, so if I hadn't it cud have been another 18 months b4 it was found at next mammogram, but if it was 2 yrs as is part of the research, it would have been found at that point ie 6 months instead of 18. And going on the trial means I get looked after longer after my treatment, I'm 3 yrs on from surgery, chemo,  rads, and only have 2 yrs of after care left to get to the 5yr point, where I would be " on my own " again, which scares me. This way I get another 7 yrs,  so yes it's me looking after me. I discussed it with many.  You won't get yearly mammograms once you are discharged it goes back to every 3 back on the mammogram screening programme. And if they didn't do the research we were all be stuck in the dark ages and nothing improves. They will also be talking to me, again as part of the trial, the after care, quality of life after treatment etc, it's not just about mammography periods. Quite frankly i would be silly to say no, whereas now i can have my say for future womens treatment and I'll also be bringing a stern rant up about letrozole shortage and the brands difference  Cheers sally
Posts.Title: Mammo 50

Posts.Content: Hi Flopsyuk They tell me that they really have no real evidence on what the good or bad frequency is for mammograms etc, ie should it be every year, 3 yearly, etc plus some patients have expressed how stressed and anxious they get when they are due a mammogram, so it may be that  a breast clinic will take over any appts, investigations, and care, reducing hospital appts or not, making the patient more at ease, less anxious and stressed, plus enhancing the care given, but until they have studied various individuals on the trial, they cannot make any formal decisions for future care for women.  It wont affect me now as im now 3 yrs in, but it may help women in the future who get this dreaded disease, and to apply resources much better, more efficiently, and less on the patient and resources, or more resources after all the discussions have been had on the trial, and it may not change it may be that what happens now is still good to go for some years yet. Im sick of going to this appt and that appt, paying for the parking every time, getting anxious before i go, hoping they dont find anything even though ive checked myself, but be aware, it doenst matter how many appts you go to, you are only as good as the scan thats taken that day, the day after could all change hence why we have to be vigilant ourselves. like me i had a mammogram and all was clear, then 18 months later get a lump, and i only found mine by accident so i guess in that respect i was lucky or not whichever you think of it Sal
Posts.Title: Mammo 50

Posts.Content: Hi yes you get steroids to build your system up abit on Fec side of chemo, and you get the antisickness pills to avoid the sickness or reduce it depending on the individual.  On the T side of fec-t you have to take double the dose of steroids the day before the day of chemo and the day after, to build the system up and try and avoid some of the side affects, then also get the antisickness as usual for 3 days the day after chemo. and the injections for 7 days or thats what im on.  i havent be ravenous at all on the steroids,, but have put some weight on, but that is more to do with before chemo as well as after as not doing my normal lot of exercise.. Sally
Posts.Title: steroids?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, hope all is well, and if not that it is not going too badly....   I had my 1st chemo week past tuesday[yest], and on saturday started a cough and wheezy, and had it since then, and some horrible rubbish coming off my chest..... temp has been up and down, but averaged around 36, and im asking is this normal, i dont feel unwell, im ok in that respect, and i know that a wheezy cough is one of the side affects but im hitting my 9-14 day point tomorrow, and dont want it to get any worse. do i ring the hosp to check, or not bother.. thanks im on FEC-T so 1st FEC done
Posts.Title: Just some advice please?

Posts.Content: Hi , i had WLE in March and then ANC in April 2014, and all other treatment finished, but still numb at times on left side of boob, and do get stabbing pains now and then, so i would say it is the nerves healing and this could take a long time. I always ask about anything at appts just so i know its checked out Sally x
Posts.Title: Boob pain after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Hi unfortunately it will never go away, I am 3 yrs post treatment and although I'm not paranoid about it I do still think of it at times, as you say when putting the sleeve on, I only have to wear mine for hockey and the allotment, I don't have to wear it every day. I do exercises on the affected breast to move any fluid across onto the good side where it drains away as normal. But  seeing adverts and it on the radio all the time doesn't help. I use the allotment for my sanity where I can switch off from everything, plus weekly tai chi session. You just have to manage it but it's bloody hard and frustrating  xxxx Sally
Posts.Title: Does cancer ever leave your thoughts?

Posts.Content: Hi Lisa, I struggled with losing my hair it was the one thing I didnt want to deal with or have happen but I knew it was going to on FEC, the dreaded red stuff, however didnt want to wear scarves as didnt want to be labelled when out, so went with hats, and have mostly worn hats, and now starting to wear my wig abit more as hoping to go back to work in the next month or so, but got last chemo of T this tuesday and still no sign of hair coming back which is annoying me now, I was hopng to see some sign. Good luck with it though, it is personal choice at the end of the day and what you are comfortable with Sally x
Posts.Title: hats and scarves ?

Posts.Content: OMG, listen to all these ladies,,, i wish when i went it was abit of wasted time in my life.... im never going to get those mins back happy, just a sad time....i hate to put a downer on it, but its the same old adage, the first time you dont go, or dont drive that way etc yadda yadda, is going to be the time, you should have done it x xxxxx
Posts.Title: Should i go to appointment?
